pull.title: [wallet] [rpc] Remove getlabeladdress RPC
pull.body:
labels are associated with addresses (rather than addresses being
associated with labels, as was the case with accounts). The
getlabeladdress does not make sense in this model, so remove it.

getaccountaddress is still supported for one release as the accounts
API is deprecated.

events.body:
Builds on top of #12953. Please remove that PR first.

In my opinion, the `getlabeladdress` should not have been introduced. However, it was included in #12892 to remove controversy and ensure that PR could be merged.

There are two main reasons for removing this RPC method:

- Labels are associated with addresses (rather than addresses being associated with labels, as was the case with accounts). The `getlabeladdress` does not make sense in this model and blurs the distinction that "labels are associated with addresses, instead of addresses associated with labels".
- Keeping `getlabeladdress` requires keeping the whole CAccount administration in place. Part of the reason for the account to label refactor is simplify the wallet mess and to get rid of that.

Many contributors have already concept ACK'ed removing this method (@laanwj at https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12892#issuecomment-379611854, @PierreRochard at https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12892#issuecomment-379874953, @promag at https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12892#pullrequestreview-110855143, @jonasschnelli at https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12892#discussion_r179550228)

Main opposition to removing this method came from @ryanofsky and @luke-jr . See https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7729#issuecomment-199444036 onwards for a full discussion.

issue.title: Remove wallet 'account' API
issue.body:
This issue tracks removing the wallet 'account' API. See issue #3816 for the reasons why this is a good idea. Rather than extend that very old and long issue, I'm opening this to track concrete actions to fully remove the 'account' API.

Actions are:

- [x] Rename account to label where appropriate (#11536)
- [x] Introduce 'label' API for wallet (~#7729~ #12892)
- [x] (V0.17) Mark 'account' API as deprecated. Wallet functional tests are updated to use `-deprecatedrpc=accounts` to maintain existing behaviour. (~#11497~ #12953)
- [x] Remove `getlabeladdress` RPC method. Keeping this method means we need to keep the `CAccount` internal accounting. (#13060)
- [x] Remove 'account' API from wallet functional tests. (#13075 and #13138)
- [x] (V0.18) Fully remove the 'account' API (#13825)

events.body:
> Main opposition to removing this method came from @ryanofsky and @luke-jr 

No opposition here, I just didn't think this should be removed or changed in the middle of a PR that otherwise was only adding functionality.

But I actually don't know what "labels are associated with addresses rather than addresses being
associated with labels" is supposed to mean. This sounds like a zen koan. It may be more accurate to say "Only one label can be associated with an address, but many addresses can be associated with one label. Labels (unlike accounts) do not have a default receiving address."

It could also be good to update release notes with a workaround for the deprecated `getaccountadddress`, though I couldn't think of anything very straightforward. Could suggest combining `getnewaddress(label)`, `listreceivedbylabel`, and `getaddressesbylabel` for a replacement depending on the use-case.

> I actually don't know what "labels are associated with addresses rather than addresses being
associated with labels".

The idea is that an address HAS labels (currently an address can have only one label, but it should be possible to extend that in future). Conversely an account HAS addresses, ie the address belongs to the account.

In a model where accounts have addresses, it makes sense for an account to have a 'default receiving address'. It doesn't make sense for a label to have a 'default receiving address', since a label is just a description that can be attached to one or more addresses.

I don't think that's too mystical. The relationship of addresses owning labels is simple, and the existence of a 'label address' confuses that simple relationship.

> It could also be good to update release notes with a workaround for the deprecated getaccountadddress, though I couldn't think of anything very straightforward.

There are two suggested workarounds here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7729#issuecomment-200219840 and here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7729#issuecomment-206929678.

I'm happy to add those to the release notes if you think that's a good idea.

Concept ACK. Will review in detail after #12953 merged.
(it has been merged, please rebase)

Purged GitHub to get rid of the merged commits without rebase:

<details><summary></summary>

```
git push git@github.com:jnewbery/bitcoin.git a3d7d6ad9ff3b40904fae0b8d97b46126e810f3b:remove_getlabeladdress && git push git@github.com:jnewbery/bitcoin.git 8d22e03929f1c6fdcf8669fb01246b7099d861f2:remove_getlabeladdress -f
```
</details>

events.message:
[wallet] [rpc] Remove getlabeladdress RPC

labels are associated with addresses (rather than addresses being
associated with labels, as was the case with accounts). The
getlabeladdress does not make sense in this model, so remove it.

getaccountaddress is still supported for one release as the accounts
API is deprecated.

events.body: Request that this get a V17.0 tag. it's not essential that it goes in for the next release, but it'd be preferable to not change the API twice in two consecutive releases if possible.

issue.title: scripted-diff: Avoid temporary copies when looping over std::map
issue.body:
The ::value_type of the std::map/std::multimap/std::unordered_map containers is
std::pair<const Key, T>. Dropping the const results in an unnecessary copy,
for example in C++11 range-based loops.

For this I started with a more general scripted diff, then narrowed it down
based on the inspection showing that all actual map/multimap/unordered_map
variables used in loops start with m or have map in the name.

issue.title: Timeline: Removal of outdated internal accounting system
issue.body:
The internal accounting system is sorely outdated, largely un-maintained, and even "broken" in certain cases. It is not an adequate system for managing multiple user's funds in any way. As such, it has been completely removed upstream.

We are following suit with it's removal, and this issue can serve as a timeline overview and discussion area for working towards it's eventual removal.

Progression towards removal will need to be handled over several stages (and release versions) to allow sufficient time for those currently using it to adopt alternative accounting methods:

Stage 1: Add output for all RPC commands that are accounting system related noting that such commands are deprecated, and will be removed in a future version. (no functional changes)

Stage 2: Disable-by-default all RPC commands that are accounting system related, but allow users to enable them at runtime if so desired. Migrate/Introduce "labels" as a replacement where appropriate, following upstream's newer Label API.

Stage 3: Finalize deletion of the (depreciated) accounting API/RPC, at which point they will no longer exist in the codebase.

------------------------

References from upstream:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/5575
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11536
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12892
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12953
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13060
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/c9c32e6b844fc79467b7e24c6c916142a0d08484

issue.title: [Tracking] Remove wallet 'account' API
issue.body:
This is a tracking issue for the removal of the wallet's built-in 'account' API, which is clunky, error-prone, and already marked deprecated. An earlier issue (#1248) outlined the general timeline plan for this removal, this issue will track actionable changes required for each stage.

Stage 1 (v4.0.1 Jan 13 2020, *completed*):
 - [x] [RPC] Notate all account stuff as deprecated (#1251)

Stage 2 (v4.2.0 TBA, *completed* #1731):
 - [x] Rename account to label where appropriate (ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11536)
 - [x] Simplify getbalance implementation (ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9614)
 - [x] Give RPC commands more information about the RPC request (ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8788)
 - [x] Introduce 'label' API for wallet (ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12892)
 - [x] Disable account RPC functions by default. Wallet functional tests updated to use -deprecatedrpc=accounts to maintain existing behaviour (ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12953)
 - [x] Remove `getlabeladdress` intermediary RPC method (ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13060)
 - [x] Add filter option to listreceivedbyaddress (ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9991)
 - [x] Remove 'account' API from wallet functional tests (ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13075)
 - [x] Fixups from account API deprecation (ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13498)

Stage 3 (v5.0.0 TBA, *pending*):
 - [ ] Fully remove the 'account' API (ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13825 = https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/c9c32e6b844fc79467b7e24c6c916142a0d08484)

labels.name: RPC
labels.description: Some notable changes to RPC params/behaviour/descriptions

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -92,17 +92,25 @@ def _run_subtest(self, accounts_api, node):
         # recognize the label/address associations.
         labels = [Label(name, accounts_api) for name in ("a", "b", "c", "d", "e")]
         for label in labels:
-            label.add_receive_address(node.getlabeladdress(label=label.name, force=True))
+            if accounts_api:
+                address = node.getaccountaddress(label.name)
+            else:
+                address = node.getnewaddress()
comments.body:
`address = node.getnewaddress(label.name)`?
(or is the point here to test setlabel?)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -92,17 +92,25 @@ def _run_subtest(self, accounts_api, node):
         # recognize the label/address associations.
         labels = [Label(name, accounts_api) for name in ("a", "b", "c", "d", "e")]
         for label in labels:
-            label.add_receive_address(node.getlabeladdress(label=label.name, force=True))
+            if accounts_api:
+                address = node.getaccountaddress(label.name)
+            else:
+                address = node.getnewaddress()
comments.body:
No, yours is better. `setlabel` is tested further down.

Fixed and pushed the new version.
